result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn A Hodgkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 98 days sentence credit.
AMENDED 03-22-2016:  Defendant is not entitled to any sentence credit on this case.
Consecutive to: defendant's revocated case (04CF1254 or 05CF31).

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and can be taken out of prison wages or trust accounts.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Anger Management or Domestic Violence counseling and follow through if Agent deems appropriate.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint except fo purposes of co-parenting minor child and only with completion of a domestic violence class and Agent's approval.
Comply with any and all court orders.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 2/16/17 Motion Hearing

Order Denying - Defense Post Conviction Motion To Impose and Stay Court Costs & Surcharges and Reduction of Sentence.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 02/16/17.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Shawn A Hodgkins in court, in custody (OTP'd From Green Bay Correctional), with attorney Alexander Dominic Cossi.   
Post Conviction Motion filed by Defense - To Impose and Stay Court Costs & Surcharges and Reduction of Sentence 

Atty. Cossi presented arguments to the court.
State presented arguments to the court.

Court orders the following:  
Court's intent was to have the court costs & surcharges to be paid when the sentence commences.
The Court is hard pressed to see what authority the DOC has to collect monies on case that has not commenced yet.
However, the court believes this is an issue that needs to be address with DOC and not through the court.
Therefore, Court Denies the Defense Post Conviction Motion to Impose and Stay Court Costs & Surcharge.
Court also denies the Defense Motion for Reduction of Sentence (no newly discovered evidence).
Reasons placed on the record.
Court signed order.
All parties received a copy of the order in court.


Defendant to be returned to Green Bay Correctional - FORTHWITH.
Dated 2/15/17 filed by State.

Extended Supervision: 6 Months.

98 Days Credit.

No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
